sections.summary: The Quran is revealed as a **reminder** for those who fear Allah rather than a cause of distress. Allah is the **Most Merciful** who is settled upon the **Throne** and possesses the **Most Beautiful Names**.

Moses is called in the **sacred valley of Tuwa**, where he is commanded to establish **prayer** and is granted **miracles**. He requests the assistance of his brother **Aaron** to share the burden of the prophetic mission.

Allah recounts the **divine protection** provided to Moses since his infancy to ensure he was reared under His observation. The messengers are directed to speak to **Pharaoh** with gentle speech to facilitate his remembrance or fear of Allah.

Pharaoh challenges the existence of the Lord, leading to a public trial against **magicians** whose tricks are swallowed by Moses’ staff. The magicians embrace **faith** in the Lord of Aaron and Moses, preferring the eternal **highest ranks** over worldly life.

Moses leads the believers across the sea on a dry path while Pharaoh’s army is **engulfed** by the water. Believers are commanded to enjoy **lawful provisions** without excess, as Allah is **Forgiving** to those who repent.

During Moses’ absence, the **Samarian** misleads the people into the **idolatry** of a golden calf. Moses rebukes the people and destroys the idol, affirming that Allah is the only **One God** besides whom there is no other.

Those who turn away from the **Reminder** will carry a heavy burden on the Day of Resurrection. Allah is the **True King** who revealed the Quran in Arabic and commanded the Prophet to pray for an **increase in knowledge**.

Adam failed in his **resolve** and was deceived by **Satan** into eating from the tree of immortality. Following their descent, Allah promises **guidance** to ensure that those who follow it will not go astray or suffer.

Neglecting the **Reminder** leads to a **confined life** and being raised blind on the Day of Resurrection. Believers are commanded to practice **patience** and adhere to the **prayer** at the borders of the day.
